intro: Gymnosphaera melanotricha, commonly known as the black-haired pine, is a rare and unique coniferous plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive dark, hairy foliage that gives it its common name. The plant exhibits a slow growth rate and thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Gymnosphaera melanotricha has a conical shape and produces small, cone-like structures that contain its seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
